duck: Ocular dominance - Ocular dominance, sometimes called eye dominance or eyedness, is the tendency to prefer visual input from one eye to the other.
Chirality (physics) - A chiral phenomenon is one that is not identical to its mirror image (see Chirality).
The Right Hand - The Right Hand is a Neo-baroque/gothic band from Santa Barbara, California formed in early 2001 by Peter Alaric DeSimone.
Using the right hand more skillfully or easily than the left.
Handedness - Handedness is an attribute of humans defined by their unequal distribution of fine motor skill between the left and right hands.
Footedness - Footedness, similar to handedness, is the natural preference of one's left or right foot for various purposes.
Right-handedness is the form of handedness in which one has greater coordination and dexterity in the right hand than in the left hand.
Asymmetry - Asymmetry is the absence of, or a violation of, a symmetry.

wiki.text:
'Handedness' is a vague term that does not have a fixed or agreed definition.
Although the terms left and right are enough to define handedness in an ordinary
disclosure, they do not suffice for scientific research.<ref name= annett></ref>
The scientific definition of handedness can be based on two theoretical
assumptions. It can be defined as the hand that performs faster or more
precisely on tasks or the hand that one prefers to use, regardless of
performance.<ref name= indiana>http://www.indiana.edu/~primate/brain.html</ref>
In a scientific study, it should be recognized that handedness is not a discrete
variable (right or left), but a continuous one that can be expressed at various
levels between strong left and strong right.<ref name=annett/> There are four
different types of handedness that include: left-handedness, right-handedness,
mixed-handedness, and ambidexterity.<ref name=indiana/> Globally, roughly 12% of
men and 10% of women are left-handed.<ref name="Papadatou"/>
wiki.title: Handedness
